properties.areaDesc: Hawk Channel from Ocean Reef to Craig Key out to the reef; Straits of Florida from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge out 20 NM; Hawk Channel from Craig Key to west end of Seven Mile Bridge out to the reef; Bayside and Gulf side from Craig Key to West End of Seven Mile Bridge; Florida Bay including Barnes Sound, Blackwater Sound, and Buttonwood Sound; Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to south of Halfmoon Shoal out 20 NM; Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas out 20 NM; Gulf of Mexico from West End of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5 Fathoms; Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to south of Halfmoon Shoal 20 to 60 NM out; Gulf waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 NM out and beyond 5 fathoms; Straits of Florida from Halfmoon Shoal to 20 NM west of Dry Tortugas 20 to 60 NM out; Hawk Channel from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to Halfmoon Shoal out to the reef
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 4 at 4:58PM EST by NWS Key West FL
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Hawk Channel and Straits of Florida from Craig Key to 20 nm west of
Dry Tortugas out 20 nm...
Straits of Florida from west end of Seven Mile Bridge to 20 nm west
of Dry Tortugas 20 to 60 nm out...
Bay and Gulf Side from Craig Key to Halfmoon Shoal out to 5
fathoms...
Florida Bay including Barnes Sound, Blackwater Sound, and Buttonwood
Sound...
Gulf Waters from East Cape Sable to Chokoloskee 20 to 60 nm out and
beyond 5 fathoms...
Hawk Channel from Ocean Reef to Craig Key out to the reef...

At 449 PM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists detected a
fast moving cold front capable of producing wind gusts near 30 knots.
This front was located from 9 nm west of Middle Cape Sable to 40 nm
south of Twenty-Eight Foot Shoal Light, moving east at 25 knots.

Locations impacted include...
Big Pine Shoal, Annette Key, Vandenberg, Blacklion Bay, Dump Keys,
Howe Key and East Sambo.

Prepare for winds shifting to west to northwest and strengthen to 20
to 25 knots with gusts near 30 knots and locally rough and confused
seas.

NWSheadline: FAST MOVING COLD FRONT TRACKING EASTWARD ACROSS FLORIDA KEYS WATERS
